page.title: 02Historical
page.content: Tairgwaith past and present. In 1910 a tarmacadamed road brought bus loads of men up to the East Pit to work. This road went along St.David's road and pas the club towards the pit. The local men walked to work.The only other tarmac road was Llwyncelyn passing the school, post office and the Coop. The other roads were unmade. there was a very busy railway with three steam trains bringing many trucks of anthracite down to the main line. There was a maintenance shed down by the Maerdy Pit employing several men. Apart from the East Pit most of the land was either farm or common land. Cows, horses and sheep roamed all over the place, damaging gardens and making an awful mess. As there were no lights on the roads these animals caused many accidents.
